alert.note: Alert for Chatham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:04PM EST until January 11 at 12:17PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Haw River Near Bynum affecting Chatham County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Haw River At Haw River affecting Alamance County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Haw River near Bynum. * WHEN...From this evening to early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. The river widens up to 400 feet across. It floods pastureland on the right bank and woodlands on the left. At 15.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. The river widens up to 800 feet across, but flooding remains confined to extensive stretches of woods and pastureland along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:46 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:46 PM EST Tuesday was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Haw River Bynum 11.0 11.7 Tue 9 pm EST 10.8 6.6 5.6 5.2 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1015 AM EST.
